shortdesc.ph: Sets the format of the raw audio data for playback.
Sets the data format of the playback raw audio.
Sets the format of the raw audio data for playback.
Sets the format of the playback raw audio data.

p.codeblock: Future<void> setPlaybackAudioFrameParameters( {required int sampleRate, required int channel, required RawAudioFrameOpModeType mode, required int samplesPerCall});
public abstract int SetPlaybackAudioFrameParameters(int sampleRate, int channel, RAW_AUDIO_FRAME_OP_MODE_TYPE mode, int samplesPerCall);

section.p: The SDK calculates the sampling interval based on the samplesPerCall, sampleRate, and channel parameters in this method. The formula is: sampling interval = samplesPerCall / (sampleRate × channel). Make sure the sampling interval is no less than 0.01 seconds. The SDK triggers the callback based on this interval.

The SDK calculates the sampling interval using the samplesPerCall, sampleRate, and channel parameters in this method. The formula is: sampling interval = samplesPerCall / (sampleRate × channel). Ensure that the sampling interval is no less than 0.01 seconds. The SDK triggers the callback based on this interval.

The SDK calculates the sampling interval using the samplesPerCall, sampleRate, and channel parameters in this method. The formula is: sampling interval = samplesPerCall / (sampleRate × channel). Ensure the sampling interval is no less than 0.01 seconds. The SDK triggers the callback based on this interval.

The SDK calculates the sampling interval using the samplesPerCall, sampleRate, and channel parameters in this method. The formula is: sampling interval = samplesPerCall / (sampleRate × channel). Make sure the sampling interval is no less than 0.01 seconds. The SDK triggers the callback based on this sampling interval.

section.title: Timing
section.p: You must call this method before joining a channel.
You must call this method before joining a channel.
You must call this method before joining a channel.
You must call this method before joining a channel.

plentry.pd: The sampling rate (Hz) of the audio data. You can set it to 8000, 16000, 24000, 32000, 44100, or 48000.

The number of audio channels. You can set it to 1 or 2:
1: Mono.
2: Stereo.
The usage mode of the audio frame. See .
The number of audio samples per call. Typically set to 1024 in scenarios like CDN streaming.

The number of audio samples per call. Typically 1024 in scenarios like RTMP streaming.

section.title: Return Values

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and troubleshooting.
< 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and troubleshooting.

section.p:
This method returns no value if the call succeeds. If the method call fails, it throws an , which you need to catch and handle. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and troubleshooting suggestions.
